question_text: What happens when a system runs out of available RAM while executing multiple applications?
answer_options: The system stores data in the BIOS chip temporarily.
The system shuts down immediately to protect memory.
The system begins using slower secondary storage as virtual memory.
The CPU disables all unused cores to conserve space.
correct_answer: The system begins using slower secondary storage as virtual memory.
explanation: When RAM is full, operating systems use part of the storage drive as virtual memory, which slows down performance significantly compared to actual RAM.
